comments: The evaluation engine needs to support calls on varargs methods.

Implemented.
The evaluation engine now correctly support varargs method invocations.

SourceBasedSourceGenerator, BinaryBasedSourceGenerator - updated to correctly
recreate the declaration of varargs methods.
ASTInstructionCompiler - updated to generate the correct instruction sequence
for varargs method invocation.

Example:
* debug to the breakpoint, select an evaluate "doit(3, "sam", "foo", "boo");"

public class HelloWorld {

    public static void main(String[] args) {
        new HelloWorld().foo();
    }
    
    public void foo() {
        doit(3, "sam", "foo", "boo"); <--- BREAKPOINT
    }
    
    public void doit(int x, Object... things) {
        for (int i = 0; i < things.length; i++) {
            Object object = things[i];
            System.out.println(object);
        }
    }
}

Fixed.

ASTInstructionCompiler - I forgot to increment an counter ...
SourceBasedSourceGenerator - The new method can be called only if the code is
compiled in Java 5.0 mode, added required test.
Verified. Filed bug 76860 for a new problem I found.

traces.message: Operation not supported in JLS2 AST
